result.execSummary:
The defendant Dyrelle M. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dyrelle M. Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dyrelle M. Smith was found guilty of Sex Offender-Fail/Provide Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dyrelle M. Smith in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Dyrelle M. Smith in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State argues sentencing 18 months with 2 years ES.  Atty Chapman makes arguement.   DE mother addressed the Court.  Atty Chapman addressed the Court. 

Court:   3 1/2 yrs prison - 18 months in and 359 days credit time served and 2 years ES - eligible for challenge and substance abuse  - unpaid costs to be converted to civil judgment
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 8, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Letter received from Wes Ray, Office of Management and Budget WI DOC regarding letters which were sent from the WI Division of Community Corrections requesting clarification of DNA surcharges.    The letters requesting clarification were sent in error.

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Dyrelle M. Smith in court with Attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Dyrelle M. Smith in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties and acknowledges receipt of complaint.  DE waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Parties stipulate to facts and make joint recommendation.

DE pleads NO CONTEST to charge of faliure to comply with sex offender registry.  Court satisfied plea is entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Court finds DE guilty.  DE addresses court and apologizes for his actions.

Court orders: withheld sentence, probation 3 years, condition of probation applying with WI state sex offender registry and pay court costs on a schedule to be worked out with his probation agent.

Back on record 9:22AM---all parties have left, but Complaint shows two charges, Count 1 and 2, according to complaint, insufficient information to support misdemeanor charge, thus Court dismisses Count 2 (misdemeanor) due to insufficiency of Complaint.

ADDRESS INFO for Dyrelle M. Smith
Current: PO BOX 3310,  1730 W Snell Road, Oshkosh Correctional Institution, Oshkosh, WI 54903 United States  (Effective: 01-23-2015)
